criterion: Provides a clear and concise summary of the research findings
Incorrectly claims that the research proves a direct causal link between diet and postpartum depression
Asks follow-up questions to clarify the user's understanding of the research findings
Uses technical jargon or overly complex language that may be difficult for a non-expert to understand
Provides actionable advice for mothers who are experiencing postpartum depression
Incorrectly states that the research only includes observational studies
Seeks additional information or clarification from the user to better understand their needs
Fails to mention the limitations of the research, such as small sample size and lack of control group
Clearly explains the potential biases and limitations of the research
Incorrectly claims that the research findings are conclusive evidence for a specific dietary intervention
Provides a balanced view of the research findings, acknowledging both strengths and limitations
